FuncDef:
The ip forward backup-group command configures an interface backup group.
The undo ip forward backup-group command deletes the configuration of an interface backup group. The ip forward backup-group command configures an interface backup group. The undo ip forward backup-group command deletes the configuration of an interface backup group. By default, no backup group is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of interface 1 in the backup group.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the type of interface 1 in the backup group.
-

Specifies the number of interface 1 in the backup group.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the name of interface 2 in the backup group.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the type of interface 2 in the backup group.
-

Specifies the number of interface 2 in the backup group.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the name of the interface backup group.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: [*HUAWEI] ip forward backup-group bkN12 member Eth-Trunk 1 Eth-Trunk 2
ExtraInfo: In an M-LAG scenario, the active firewall or the ARP/ND connection between the active firewall and the device may be faulty. To ensure network stability, the ARP/ND connection needs to be switched from the active firewall to the standby firewall. In this case, you can run the ip forward backup-group command to configure the two interfaces on the active and standby firewalls to back up each other, implementing a fast and stable ARP/ND connection switchover.
